text: Clement VII (; 26 May 1478 â€“ 25 September 1534), born Giulio di Giuliano de' Medici, was an Italian cleric of the Roman Catholic Church. He was the 119th Pope from 1523 to 1534. "List of Popes," Catholic Encyclopedia (2009); retrieved 2011-11-16. ==Early life== Giulio di Medici was born in Florence one month after his father's death. He was the nephew of Lorenzo de' Medici and he was a cousin of Pope Leo X."Pope Pius IV," Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2011-11-16. ==Bishop== Leo X made Medici the Archbishop of Florence. ==Cardinal== On 23 September 1513, Medici was made cardinal.Society for the Diffusion of Useful Knowledge. (1837). "Clement VII," Penny cyclopaedia, Vol. 7, p. 250. ==Pope== In 1523, Cardinal Medici was elected pope. He chose to be called Clement VII. Pope Clement was involved in Italian and European political disputes.[3] Clement ordered Michelangelo's painting of The Last Judgment in the Sistine Chapel. ==Related pages == * List of popes * List of popes from the Medici family ==References== ==Other websites== * * "Clement VII (Pope)," Encyclopedia Britannica, 1911 * Catholic Hierarchy, Popes Clement VII * Cardinals of the Holy Roman Church , Cardinal Medici Category:Italian popes Category:House of Medici Category:People from Florence Category:1478 births Category:1534 deaths
title: Pope Clement VII
